item.title: Publications
item.description: 1. Jonathan Ito and Stacy Marsella. Context dependent utility: modeling decision behavior across contexts. In Proceedings of 35th Annual Conference of the Cognitive Science Society (to appear), 2013. [ bib | .pdf ] One significant challenge in creating accurate models of human decision behavior is accounting for the effect of context. Research shows that seemingly minor changes in the presentation of a decision can lead to drastic shifts in behavior; phenomena collectively referred to as framing effects.
